tossupQ:
CHEMISTRY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is NOT true: 
 
W)  any foreign substance added to water will cause a freezing point drop 
X)  a nonvolatile solute raises the boiling point of a solvent 
Y)  methane has a higher boiling point than ethane 
Z)  freezing point depression is a colligative property
tossupA: Y)  METHANE HAS A HIGHER BOILING POINT THAN ETHANE

for aluminum bicarbonate?

W)  1 micrometer

bonusQ:
PHYSICS  Short Answer  Consider a planet where g equals 5.0 meters per second squared.  
Ignoring friction, if an object started from rest, how far would it fall vertically off a cliff in 4.0 
seconds, giving your answer in standard SI units?
bonusA:
40 METERS  (must give units) 
 
(Solution: d = ½ × at2 = ½ × 5× 42 = 40 meters)

EARTH SCIENCE  Multiple Choice  The Earth’s greenhouse effect is primarily caused by which 
of the following: 
 
W)  incoming solar ultraviolet light is absorbed by the ozone layer 
X)  outgoing infrared solar radiation is trapped by the lower atmosphere 
Y)  incoming infrared solar radiation is trapped by the magnetic field 
Z)  outgoing X-rays are absorbed by the troposphere and reflected to the Earth’s surface
bonusA:
X)  OUTGOING INFRARED SOLAR RADIATION IS TRAPPED BY THE LOWER 
ATMOSPHERE

tossupQ:
GENERAL SCIENCE  Multiple Choice  Ed the entomologist is setting up mosquito traps in a 
farmer’s field in Nebraska.  Which of the following would be the BEST mosquito attractant to 
ensure he traps the greatest number and variety of mosquitoes: 
 
W)  oxygen  
X)  nitrogen  
Y)  dry ice 
Z)  methane
tossupA:
Y)  DRY ICE 
 
(Solution: mosquitoes attracted to CO<sub>2</sub>)

ASTRONOMY  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is LEAST accurate: 
 
W)  most stars visible to the unaided eye are part of the Milky Way galaxy 
X)  there are 88 constellations officially recognized by the IAU 
Y)  a red supergiant has a hotter surface than our Sun

Y)  the Pleiades is an open star cluster

bonusA: Z)  THERE IS MORE LITHIUM THAN CARBON IN THE UNIVERSE

bonusQ:
EARTH SCIENCE  Multiple Choice  Which of the following is NOT true of basalt and gabbro: 
 
W)  they formed from magma at the same temperature 
X)  they are derived from basaltic magma 
Y)  they formed from magma with the same silica content 
Z)  they are both intrusive igneous rocks
bonusA:
Z)  THEY ARE BOTH INTRUSIVE IGNEOUS ROCKS 
 
(Solution: basalt = extrusive;  gabbro = intrusive)

bonusQ:
CHEMISTRY  Short Answer  A 4.0 gram sample of calcium chloride contains 6.0 × 1022 
cations.  Giving your answer in scientific notation to the nearest whole number, determine the 
number of anions in 2 grams of CaCl<sub>2</sub>.  Assume the atomic mass of calcium is 40 and chloride is 35.
bonusA:
6 × 1022 
 
(Solution: (2g CaCl<sub>2</sub>)(6.0 × 1022 Ca<sub>2</sub>+/4g CaCl<sub>2</sub>)(2 Cl–/1 Ca<sub>2</sub>+) = 6.0 × 1022 Cl–)

bonusQ:
CHEMISTRY  Short Answer  A sample of oxygen gas is collected over water at 14ºC.  
Knowing that the vapor pressure of water at 14ºC is 1.6 kilopascals, and that the pressure of the 
resultant mixture is 120 kilopascals, find the pressure, to the first decimal place, exerted by the dry 
oxygen alone:
bonusA:
118.4 
 
(Solution: Pdry = Pt – Pwv = 120 kPa – 1.6 kPa = 118.4 kPa)
